trans-unit.source: Displays bitmaps that have transparent or semitransparent pixels

seg-source.mrk: Displays bitmaps that have transparent or semitransparent pixels

target.mrk: Displays bitmaps that have transparent or semitransparent pixels

trans-unit.source: Parameters

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: Handle to the destination device context.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the destination device context.

target.mrk: Handle to the destination device context.

trans-unit.source: The x-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the destination rectangle.

seg-source.mrk: The x-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the destination rectangle.

target.mrk: The x-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the destination rectangle.

trans-unit.source: The y-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the destination rectangle.

seg-source.mrk: The y-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the destination rectangle.

target.mrk: The y-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the destination rectangle.

trans-unit.source: The width, in logical units, of the destination rectangle.

seg-source.mrk: The width, in logical units, of the destination rectangle.

target.mrk: The width, in logical units, of the destination rectangle.

trans-unit.source: The height, in logical units, of the destination rectangle.

seg-source.mrk: The height, in logical units, of the destination rectangle.

target.mrk: The height, in logical units, of the destination rectangle.

trans-unit.source: Handle to the source device context.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the source device context.

target.mrk: Handle to the source device context.

trans-unit.source: The x-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the source rectangle.

seg-source.mrk: The x-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the source rectangle.

target.mrk: The x-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the source rectangle.

trans-unit.source: The y-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the source rectangle.

seg-source.mrk: The y-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the source rectangle.

target.mrk: The y-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the source rectangle.

trans-unit.source: The width, in logical units, of the source rectangle.

seg-source.mrk: The width, in logical units, of the source rectangle.

target.mrk: The width, in logical units, of the source rectangle.

trans-unit.source: The height, in logical units, of the source rectangle.

seg-source.mrk: The height, in logical units, of the source rectangle.

target.mrk: The height, in logical units, of the source rectangle.

trans-unit.source: The alpha transparency value to be used on the entire source bitmap.

seg-source.mrk: The alpha transparency value to be used on the entire source bitmap.

target.mrk: The alpha transparency value to be used on the entire source bitmap.

trans-unit.source: This value is combined with any per-pixel alpha values in the source bitmap.

seg-source.mrk: This value is combined with any per-pixel alpha values in the source bitmap.

target.mrk: This value is combined with any per-pixel alpha values in the source bitmap.

trans-unit.source: If you set $iAlpha to 0, it is assumed that your image is transparent.

seg-source.mrk: If you set $iAlpha to 0, it is assumed that your image is transparent.

target.mrk: If you set $iAlpha to 0, it is assumed that your image is transparent.

trans-unit.source: Set $iAlpha value to 255 (opaque) when you only want to use per-pixel alpha values.

seg-source.mrk: Set $iAlpha value to 255 (opaque) when you only want to use per-pixel alpha values.

target.mrk: Set $iAlpha value to 255 (opaque) when you only want to use per-pixel alpha values.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Specifies whether uses an alpha channel from the source bitmap, valid values:

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
Specifies whether uses an alpha channel from the source bitmap, valid values:

target.mrk: [optional]
Specifies whether uses an alpha channel from the source bitmap, valid values:

trans-unit.source: True - Use the alpha channel (that is, per-pixel alpha).

seg-source.mrk: True - Use the alpha channel (that is, per-pixel alpha).

target.mrk: True - Use the alpha channel (that is, per-pixel alpha).

trans-unit.source: Note that the APIs use premultiplied alpha, which means that the red, green and blue channel values in the bitmap must be premultiplied with the alpha channel value.

seg-source.mrk: Note that the APIs use premultiplied alpha, which means that the red, green and blue channel values in the bitmap must be premultiplied with the alpha channel value.

target.mrk: Note that the APIs use premultiplied alpha, which means that the red, green and blue channel values in the bitmap must be premultiplied with the alpha channel value.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the alpha channel value is x, the red, green and blue channels must be multiplied by x and divided by 255 prior to the call.

seg-source.mrk: For example, if the alpha channel value is x, the red, green and blue channels must be multiplied by x and divided by 255 prior to the call.

target.mrk: For example, if the alpha channel value is x, the red, green and blue channels must be multiplied by x and divided by 255 prior to the call.

trans-unit.source: False - Do not use the alpha channel (Default).

seg-source.mrk: False - Do not use the alpha channel (Default).

target.mrk: False - Do not use the alpha channel (Default).

trans-unit.source: Return Value

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: True.

seg-source.mrk: True.

target.mrk: True.

trans-unit.source: False.

seg-source.mrk: False.

target.mrk: False.

trans-unit.source: Remarks

seg-source.mrk: Remarks

target.mrk: Remarks

trans-unit.source: If the source rectangle and destination rectangle are not the same size, the source bitmap is stretched to match the destination rectangle.

seg-source.mrk: If the source rectangle and destination rectangle are not the same size, the source bitmap is stretched to match the destination rectangle.

target.mrk: If the source rectangle and destination rectangle are not the same size, the source bitmap is stretched to match the destination rectangle.

trans-unit.source: If the _WinAPI_SetStretchBltMode() function is used, the stretching mode value is automatically converted to $COLORONCOLOR for this function (that is, $BLACKONWHITE, $WHITEONBLACK, and $HALFTONE are changed to $COLORONCOLOR).

seg-source.mrk: If the _WinAPI_SetStretchBltMode() function is used, the stretching mode value is automatically converted to $COLORONCOLOR for this function (that is, $BLACKONWHITE, $WHITEONBLACK, and $HALFTONE are changed to $COLORONCOLOR).

target.mrk: If the _WinAPI_SetStretchBltMode() function is used, the stretching mode value is automatically converted to $COLORONCOLOR for this function (that is, $BLACKONWHITE, $WHITEONBLACK, and $HALFTONE are changed to $COLORONCOLOR).

trans-unit.source: If destination and source bitmaps do not have the same color format, _WinAPI_AlphaBlend() function converts the source bitmap to match the destination bitmap.

seg-source.mrk: If destination and source bitmaps do not have the same color format, _WinAPI_AlphaBlend() function converts the source bitmap to match the destination bitmap.

target.mrk: If destination and source bitmaps do not have the same color format, _WinAPI_AlphaBlend() function converts the source bitmap to match the destination bitmap.
